references.paper_title: High-resolution image synthesis with latent diffusion models.
references.reason: This paper introduces Latent Diffusion Models (LDM), a foundational model for efficient high-resolution image synthesis, thus providing a critical basis for this work.

This reference is crucial because it introduces classifier-free diffusion guidance, a technique extensively used in this work to enhance the quality of generated images by incorporating unconditional output at each denoising step.

references.paper_title: Sdxl: Improving latent diffusion models for high-resolution image synthesis.
references.reason: This work is important because this paper uses SDXL as the default base model which is able to generate images at 1024 x 1024 resolution by default.
This work is important because it serves as the default sampling process in this paper using the deterministic sampling formula in DDIM.

references.paper_title: Scaling rectified flow transformers for high-resolution image synthesis.
references.reason: This work is important because it introduces rectified flow transformers which is another technique used in this paper.
